page.title: 13CROFT NEW VILLAGE HALL 1985.
page.content: For many years a timber hut served as a centre for village activities. The hut began to reach the end of its useful life and activities either ceased or transferred to the new school accommodation. In May,1983 young villagers asked the Parish Council to consider the need for a new Village Hall, primarily to provide for Youth activities. A committee under the chairmanship of Bill Chaytor was formed to consider the possibilities. Through the generosity of Mr. David Kellie-Smith, monies were made available from his mother's estate to help a worthy cause. The Executors assessed the committee's proposals,and agreed they would provide financial help.A new prefabricated hall has been chosen. Final arrangements have been made for completion this year(1985).
